issues.description: The exercise uses two different method names for the same concept (the animal feeding sound): 'messageOnFeed()' and 'getFeedingSound()'. Part 1 explicitly asks students to implement an abstract method messageOnFeed(), the UML and many instructions refer to messageOnFeed(), and the solution implements messageOnFeed(). However, parts of the problem text (song template placeholders and the Part 2 descriptions) and some comments refer to getFeedingSound(). This naming mismatch is a structural inconsistency because it can confuse students about which method to implement and which method Farm should call when printing feeding sounds. Students might implement messageOnFeed() (as requested in Part 1) but then be unsure whether to call getFeedingSound() in Farm (because the song and some instructions mention it), or might implement getFeedingSound() instead and fail tests that expect messageOnFeed().
issues.suggested_fix:
Choose one coherent method name for the feeding-sound method and use it everywhere. Preferred options:
- Standardize on messageOnFeed(): update all occurrences of getFeedingSound() in the problem statement (song placeholders and descriptive text) and in template comments to messageOnFeed(). Update the UML and examples accordingly.
OR
- If you prefer getFeedingSound(), change the Part 1 instruction and the solution to declare and implement getFeedingSound() (and update all references to messageOnFeed()).
Ensure the Farm class in the template and the song examples call the chosen method name so students are not confused about which method to implement or invoke.

issues.description: The problem description uses the method name getFeedingSound() in several places (task descriptions for Seal/Pig/Goat and in the Farm feedAllAnimals() description), while the UML, task earlier descriptions, template/solution code and final implementation use the method name messageOnFeed(). This inconsistent naming for the same conceptual operation (the animal's feeding sound) can confuse students about which method they should implement and call (messageOnFeed() vs getFeedingSound()).
issues.suggested_fix: Use a single, consistent method name across the problem statement, template, and solution. Prefer the name already used in the UML and solution: messageOnFeed(). Update the problem text occurrences of getFeedingSound() (Seal/Pig/Goat task descriptions and the feedAllAnimals() description) to messageOnFeed(). Alternatively, if you prefer getFeedingSound(), update the UML, template stubs, and solution code to use getFeedingSound() everywhere — but ensure only one name is used across all artifacts.
